description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 3} mod 8.
comments: Primes of this sequence are in A033203. All of these numbers satisfy the condition that n XOR 4 = n + 4. - Brad Clardy, Jul 24 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = 8 * floor(n/4) + (n mod 4), with offset 0.. a(0)=0. - _Gary Detlefs_, Mar 09 2010From _Colin Barker_, May 14 2012: (Start)a(n) = (-7-(-1)^n-(1-i)*(-i)^n-(1+i)*i^n+4*n)/2 where i=sqrt(-1).G.f.: x^2*(1+x+x^2+5*x^3)/((1-x)^2*(1+x)*(1+x^2)). (End)a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-4) - a(n-5). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 16 2012
